name: Mixed Bag 26 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: What soap opera took place in Collinsport?
questions.explanation:
Dark Shadows.

	It only aired for five years but spawned a series of popular books, two comic book series, a newspaper comic strip, two feature films and a revised TV series.

questions.text: What is the official religion of monarchs of Denmark, Norway and Sweden?
questions.explanation:
Lutheran.

	Scandinavian Lutherans name their national churches after the names of their countries, for example: Church Of Sweden.

questions.text: Thunderhead was the son of who?
questions.explanation:
Flicka.

	'My Friend Flicka' was a show about a boy, his mare and life on the Goose Bar Ranch.

Albert Payson Terhune.

	He was born in 1872 and died in 1942. A man of faults and flaws who cared for dogs and spent a lifetime installing that love.

questions.text: Mount St. Helens erupted in which month in 1980?
questions.explanation:
May.

	It is located in the state of Washington in the Cascade Range.

questions.text: What was the total number states which seceded from the USA just prior to and during the American Civil War?
questions.explanation:
11.

	South Carolina, Mississippi, Florida, Alabama, Georgia, Louisiana, Texas, Arkansas, Tennessee, North Carolina and Virginia.

questions.text: Who was the loudmouth senator who lived in Allen's Alley?
questions.explanation:
Senator Claghorn.

	Other residents of Allen's Alley were The Average American, John Doe and poet Falstaff Openshaw, Titus Moody, Mrs. Nussbaum and Ajax Cassidy.

questions.text: What famous radio star had a longtime 'feud' with Jack Benny?
questions.explanation:
Fred Allen.

	Fred Allen ended up being the final judge for the 'I can't stand Jack Benny because' contest in 1945.

questions.text: What dance originated in the Peppermint Lounge in New York City?
questions.explanation:
Twist.

	The Peppermint Lounge was located in Manhattan in the 1960's.

questions.text: Who was the singer on the 'Jack Benny Show'?
questions.explanation:
Dennis Day.

	This show ran from October 1950 to August 1977 and had Eddie 'Rochester' Anderson as his valet and Don Wilson as his announcer.
